data.text:
2023 ARCHIVES

​** ANNUAL MEETING

​WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 29TH

​10:00 - Create artwork for the Gallery

12:00 - Brief meeting to elect officers

FOLLOWING THE MEETING - Covered dish luncheon (Roast turkey provided)

​ NOVEMBER KAPPA TAU

(for members only)

November 16th, 10 AM - Noon

Polly Johnson

A set of little nesting boxes

Bring:

- 12x12 card stock paper. Recollection Packs are sometimes on sale at Michaels. There is plenty of paper in one pack for many boxes. You may want to choose a theme.

- Double sided tape or runners tape in dispenser

- Scissors, Ruler, Pencil

​Polly will try to have extra paper and a few tape runners.

​

​2023 ALL-MEMBER SHOW WINNERS

​SANDY SMITH

TONY KLEB

SUSAN WITT

SUSAN MARCH

BECKY TURTON

BRENDA DIEHM

MIKE GREEN

STEVE HEAP

NIGEL CLARK

DENNY NURKIEWICZ

TIA HUNT

** WATERCOLOR BATIKING

Special activity for Monday & Tuesday Watercolor students only

This class will run for 3 weeks in October for the Monday & Tuesday Classes. October 23-24, 30-31, Nov 6-7

You must take all 3 days. You cannot skip one and still complete the project. You may want to view watercolor Batiking on YouTube before class to understand the process.

Supplies available in the gallery: freezer paper (if you have your own, please bring it), wax, brushes for waxing. Don’t use your watercolor brushes for waxing.

Supplies to bring: your normal watercolors and brushes; a gator board or foam board (some available in gallery). This board must be able to stand up to a hot iron and not melt. Part of the project involves ironing the wax off paper.

If you prefer to observe the process, please do come. As always you may also work on your own projects.

​

​

​

​** PROSPECTUS ART AT THE AIRPORT FALL 2023 SHOW

“Touching Down” will be the theme of the Fall 2023 Art at the Airport show, presented by the Morgantown Art Association in conjunction with the City of Morgantown and the Morgantown Airport Authority. The theme might inspire art that reflects at subject as literal as the landing of a hot air balloon or bird gliding onto the surface of a lake or as symbolic as arriving home after a long journey or having a cup of tea in front of a cozy fireplace. The show will include a special category of art with the theme “Balloons Over Morgantown,” in celebration of the University Toyota’s Morgantown Balloon Festival.

ELIGIBILITY: the exhibit is open to artists who are members or become members of the Morgantown Art Association at the time of the show. Membership information is available on the Association’s website, www.morgantownartassociation.com. All wall art must be properly matted/framed, wired for hanging and properly labeled. Sculptures and ceramics must be properly labeled and will be displayed in a glass-enclosed display case.

AWARDS: Cash prizes (made possible by University Motors) will be awarded as follows:

First Place $100

Second Place $75

Third Place $50

First Place—Photography $100

Second Place—Photography $75

Third Place—Photography $50

Honorable Mention (3 awards) $35 each

Best Representation of the “Balloons of Morgantown Theme” $100

(Each entry is eligible to win only one award.)

​TAKE-IN: Entries should be brought to the Morgantown Airport on Monday, September 18 from 10 AM to 3 PM. Each artist will be able to enter up to three pieces in the show. All pieces must be in good condition and suitable for a show located in a public facility. Final decisions regarding acceptance of art for the show will be made by the Art at the Airport Committee. The exhibit will run thru December 2023, and entries should remain on display for that time.

LIABILITY: Pieces of art will be given reasonable care; however, neither the City of Morgantown, the Morgantown Airport Authority nor the Morgantown Art Association assumes any liability for damage or loss of any art.

The Awards Reception, open to the public, will be held on Thursday, September 21 at 5:30. Prizes will be awarded at that time. Artists are encouraged to attend the reception.

​For questions or further information, please contact Susan Dotson via email to [email protected]

​

AUGUST KAPPA TAU

(for members only)

Instructor: Becky Turton

Tuesday, August 22nd 10:00 - noon

Painting with coffee

​BRING: your paint brushes and some watercolor paper. If you have an image you would like to paint, bring that. There are plenty of examples of “coffee paintings” on Pinterest.

I will bring the instant coffee and plastic spoons.

I found the plastic cups so no need to bring your own.

RSVP BY SUNDAY, AUGUST 20TH IF COMING.

​

LYNN FERRIS WORKSHOP RESCHEDULED FOR:

Friday, August 11th - Sunday, August 13th

9:00 - 4:00

​

​WRITTEN PUBLIC COMMENTS ABOUT “ART AT THE AIRPORT EXHIBIT”

MY FAVORITE PAINTING IS “SPRING STORM.” MY FAVORITE PHOTO IS “TABLE BY THE LAKE.”

JUST CAME FROM NY TO VISIT FAMILY & IT WAS A LOVELY EXHIBIT BY VERY TALENTED ARTISTS.

YES, IT’S SO EXCITING AND FUNNY.

LOVED IT!

WONDERFUL ART, CREATIVE SUBJECTS, COLORS, IDEAS.

THANKS FOR EXHIBITING!

BEAUTIFUL DISPLAY!

CAME FORM LONG ISLAND, NY. LOVE YOUR ART!!

BEAUTIFUL ART!!

WE LOVE IT

WOW

THEY ARE SO COLORFUL!

I LOVE THE DIFFERENT MEDIA

​** JULY KAPPA TAU

(for members only)

Instructor: Tia Hunt

Thursday, July 20th, 10 - Noon

POP Culture Collage

Bring an empty cereal, or any other empty box (or 2...or) with interesting graphics, colors to use and share with the class

Scissors to cut paper with Glue sticks, boards to mount collage on will be supplied, as will a surprise element!

This fun day will be shared from the experience of Michael Albert, New York artist. I attended a workshop sponsored by AGCM in Morgantown. Such fun!

​** JUNE KAPPA TAU

(for members only)

Instructor - Susan Dotson

Tuesday, June 20 from 10 am to Noon.

Scherenschitte--Sissors Cutting It's pronounced Shear-en-schnit-tah. It's a very old craft from Germany that involves creating sometimes very intricate designs from paper--something like the snowflakes you used to create in elementary school art.

​** QUILLING WORKSHOP

In the Gallery at the Mountaineer Mall 5000 Greenbag Road Morgantown, WV 26501 ​

JUNE 17, 2023 9:00 - 4:00

LIMIT 8 $25 FEE

INSTRUCTOR RITA MARKS - "Strawberries"

All materials furnished.

Contact Byron Witt:

- 26 Hunter Zane Road, Fairmont, WV 26554

- 304-292-5026

- [email protected]

(THERE WILL BE NO SIGN-UP SHEET IN THE GALLERY)

** KAPPA TAU

For members only

May 23rd 10 AM to Noon

At the Witt’s house

Supplies and food provided by the Witts.
